intro: Didissandra aurea, commonly known as the golden didissandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its attractive, waxy, yellowish-green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions. The plant produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans and animals.
